p: There are recent guidelines for managing ethical issues in infectious disease outbreaks, but they are not a practical tool for the physician at the bedside [ 4] or are relevant only for specific issues, such as research ( https://www.nuffieldbioethics.org/publications/research-in-global-health-emergencies). In outbreaks, decisions must be made quickly, even when there is yet no evidence. The challenge is to prepare practical solutions for times of epidemics.
